title: CLAUDE.md
text: Guidance agents.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Always keep file date.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: project R package called swadlr retrieves data undocumented EPI State Working America Data Library: https://data.epi.org main users package want grab time series value EPI SWADL, either use directly benchmark another calculation.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Returns tibble (data frame long format).
code: get_swadl_series(     indicator,     measure,     date_interval = c("year", "month"),     geography = "national",     dimension = "overall",     date = NULL )

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Return structured summary indicator. Returns S3 object class swadlr_indicator_info nice print method.
code: get_swadl_info(indicator)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Tests use httptest2 mock API responses fixtures tests/testthat/fixtures/. avoids hitting live API tests. Key points: - httptest2 intercepts httr2 requests req_perform() returns fixture data - throttle (throttle_if_needed()) runs request, still delay even mocked responses - tests/testthat/setup.R sets options(swadlr.throttle_interval = 0) disable throttling tests - Use testthat::test_path("fixtures") with_mock_dir() calls ensure correct path resolution devtools::test() update fixtures live API changes:
code: httptest2::start_capturing("tests/testthat/fixtures") devtools::test() httptest2::stop_capturing()

title: CLAUDE.md
text: See plans/2026-01-24-implementation-plan.md full implementation plan.

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: fetching data, can explore ’s available SWADL API.

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Topics broad categories group related indicators:
code: swadlr_topics()

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Indicators specific data series. can list indicators filter topic:
code: # List all indicators swadlr_indicators()  # List indicators for a specific topic swadlr_indicators(topic = "wages")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Measures specific ways presenting indicator data. example, wage data might available nominal dollars, real (inflation-adjusted) dollars, percentage:
code: # List all measures swadlr_measures()  # List measures for a specific indicator swadlr_measures(indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Dimensions allow subsetting data demographic categories (e.g., gender, race, education). dimension multiple values:
code: # List all dimensions and their values swadlr_dimensions()  # List dimensions for a specific indicator swadlr_dimensions(indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: package supports national, regional, divisional, state-level data:
code: # List all geographies swadlr_geographies()  # Filter to just states geographies <- swadlr_geographies() geographies[geographies$level == "state", ]

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: fetching data, use get_swadl_info() get detailed information indicator, including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability: can also access specific components info object:
code: info <- get_swadl_info("hourly_wage_percentiles") print(info) # Available measures info$measures  # Date range info$availability$date_range  # Geographic availability info$availability$geo_availability

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: main function fetching data get_swadl_series(). returns data frame columns date, value, geography, dimensions request.

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch median hourly wage time:
code: wages <- get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") ) wages

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: dimension argument supports several formats: Overall (aggregate data): Use "overall" get aggregate data without demographic breakdown: Single dimension (values): Pass dimension ID get values dimension: Single dimension (specific value): Use named list filter specific dimension values: Multiple dimensions (cross-tabulated): Combine dimensions using list. Named elements filter specific values, unnamed elements include values:
code: get_swadl_series(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   dimension = "overall" ) # All wage percentiles get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = "wage_percentile" ) # Only the 90th percentile get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p90") ) # Employment rate for males, by all age groups get_swadl_series(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "month",   dimension = list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: indicators support annual monthly data. Use date_interval argument:
code: # Annual data (default) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   date_interval = "year",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # Monthly data get_swadl_series(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "month",   dimension = "overall" )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch data different geographic levels:
code: # National data (default) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   geography = "national",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # State data (by name) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   geography = "California",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # State data (by abbreviation) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   geography = "NY",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # Census region get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   geography = "Midwest",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Filter specific dates date ranges:
code: # Single date get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50"),   date = "2023-01-01" )  # Date range get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50"),   date = c("2010-01-01", "2023-01-01") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: ’s complete example fetches wage percentiles creates summary:
code: # Fetch all wage percentiles wages <- get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = "wage_percentile",   date = c("2000-01-01", "2023-01-01") )  # View the data head(wages)  # Summary by percentile aggregate(value ~ wage_percentile, data = wages, FUN = function(x) {   c(start = x[1], end = x[length(x)], change = x[length(x)] - x[1]) })

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch employment rates states available data:
code: # Get info to see which states have data info <- get_swadl_info("labor_force_emp") info$availability$geo_availability  # Fetch data for California ca_emp <- get_swadl_series(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "year",   geography = "California",   dimension = "overall" ) ca_emp

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: package caches metadata (topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, sources) within R session minimize API calls. need refresh cache:
code: swadlr_clear_cache()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ben Zipperer. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zipperer B (2026). swadlr: Access EPI State Working America Data Library API. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://economic.github.com/swadlr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API},   author = {Ben Zipperer},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://economic.github.com/swadlr/}, }

what: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: swadlr provides access EPI State Working America Data Library (SWADL) API. enables users explore available indicators, measures, dimensions, fetch time series data national, regional, state levels.

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: can install development version swadlr GitHub:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("benzipperer/swadlr")

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: Fetch median hourly wages time: Fetch wage percentiles: Fetch state-level data:
code: library(swadlr)  # Explore what's available swadlr_topics() swadlr_indicators(topic = "wages")  # Get detailed information about an indicator get_swadl_info("hourly_wage_percentiles")  # Fetch the median hourly wage get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") ) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   dimension = "wage_percentile" ) get_swadl_series(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "real_wage_2024",   geography = "California",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: See package website full documentation Getting started vignette examples.

what: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
title: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
text: Returns detailed information specific indicator including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability, sources.

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
code: get_swadl_info(indicator)

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
text: indicator indicator ID (e.g., "hourly_wage_percentiles"). Use swadlr_indicators() see available indicators.

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
text: S3 object class swadlr_indicator_info following components: id Indicator identifier name Human-readable indicator name topic Topic ID indicator belongs updated Date indicator last updated measures Data frame available measures columns: id, name, format dimensions Data frame available dimensions columns: dimension_id, dimension_name, value_id, value_name availability List date ranges geographic availability sources Data frame sources columns: measure_id, source, url

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — get_swadl_info
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get information about hourly wage percentiles info <- get_swadl_info("hourly_wage_percentiles") print(info)  # Access specific components info$measures info$availability$date_range } # }

what: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
text: Retrieves time series data EPI State Working America Data Library API.

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
code: get_swadl_series(   indicator,   measure,   date_interval = c("year", "month"),   geography = "national",   dimension = "overall",   date = NULL )

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
text: indicator Indicator ID (e.g., "hourly_wage_percentiles"). Use swadlr_indicators() see available indicators. measure Measure ID (e.g., "real_wage_2024"). Use swadlr_measures() get_swadl_info() see available measures. date_interval Either "year" "month". Defaults "year". geography geography specification. Accepts state names (e.g., "California"), abbreviations (e.g., "CA"), region names (e.g., "Midwest"), division names (e.g., "Pacific"), API IDs (e.g., "state06"). Defaults "national". dimension Dimension specification. Can : "overall": Returns aggregate data without demographic breakdown dimension ID (e.g., "wage_percentile"): Returns values dimension list named /unnamed elements: Named elements filter specific values: list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") Unnamed elements return values: list("wage_percentile") Multiple dimensions cross-tabulated: list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") date Optional date filter. Can : NULL (default): available dates single date (character Date): Returns date vector two dates: Returns dates range (inclusive)

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
text: data frame columns: date: Observation date value: observed value geography: Geography ID One column per dimension request, containing dimension value IDs

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl_series
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Median hourly wage over time get_swadl_series(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "real_wage_2024",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # All wage percentiles get_swadl_series(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "real_wage_2024",   dimension = "wage_percentile" )  # Employment rate for males by age group get_swadl_series(   "labor_force_emp",   "percent_emp",   date_interval = "month",   dimension = list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") )  # Filter to specific date range get_swadl_series(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "real_wage_2024",   dimension = "wage_percentile",   date = c("2000-01-01", "2024-01-01") ) } # }

what: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: swadlr package provides access Economic Policy Institute's State Working America Data Library (SWADL) API. enables users explore available indicators, measures, dimensions, fetch time series data national, regional, state levels.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: main function fetching data get_swadl_series(), returns time series data specified indicator, measure, geography, dimension combination.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Use get_swadl_info() get detailed information indicator, including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Several functions help explore data available: swadlr_topics(): List available topics swadlr_indicators(): List available indicators swadlr_measures(): List available measures swadlr_dimensions(): List available dimensions swadlr_geographies(): List available geographies

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Metadata cached within R session. Use swadlr_clear_cache() refresh cache needed.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Maintainer: Ben Zipperer benzipperer@gmail.com

title: Clear the swadlr cache — swadlr_clear_cache
text: Clears cached metadata current R session. includes cached topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, sources. Use function want refresh metadata API.

title: Clear the swadlr cache — swadlr_clear_cache
code: swadlr_clear_cache()

title: Clear the swadlr cache — swadlr_clear_cache
text: Invisible NULL.

title: Clear the swadlr cache — swadlr_clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ swadlr_clear_cache() } # }

title: List available dimensions — swadlr_dimensions
text: Returns data frame available dimensions values SWADL API. Dimensions allow subsetting data demographic categories (e.g., gender, race, education).

title: List available dimensions — swadlr_dimensions
code: swadlr_dimensions(indicator = NULL)

title: List available dimensions — swadlr_dimensions
text: indicator Optional indicator ID filter dimensions available specific indicator. Use swadlr_indicators() see available indicators.

title: List available dimensions — swadlr_dimensions
text: data frame columns: dimension_id Dimension identifier dimension_name Human-readable dimension name value_id Dimension value identifier (used get_swadl_series() dimension argument) value_name Human-readable dimension value name

title: List available dimensions — swadlr_dimensions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all dimensions swadlr_dimensions()  # List dimensions for a specific indicator swadlr_dimensions(indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles") } # }

title: List available geographies — swadlr_geographies
text: Returns data frame available geographic units SWADL API. includes national level, census regions, census divisions, states plus District Columbia.

title: List available geographies — swadlr_geographies
code: swadlr_geographies()

title: List available geographies — swadlr_geographies
text: data frame columns: id Geography identifier (used get_swadl_series()) level Geographic level ("national", "region", "division", "state") name Human-readable geography name abbr Abbreviation (state postal code, "US" national, NA regions/divisions)

title: List available indicators — swadlr_indicators
text: Returns data frame available indicators SWADL API. Indicators specific data series can retrieved get_swadl_series().

title: List available indicators — swadlr_indicators
code: swadlr_indicators(topic = NULL)

title: List available indicators — swadlr_indicators
text: topic Optional topic ID filter indicators. Use swadlr_topics() see available topics.

title: List available indicators — swadlr_indicators
text: data frame columns: id Indicator identifier (used get_swadl_series()) name Human-readable indicator name topic_id ID topic indicator belongs updated_date Date indicator last updated

title: List available indicators — swadlr_indicators
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all indicators swadlr_indicators()  # List indicators for a specific topic swadlr_indicators(topic = "wages") } # }

title: List available measures — swadlr_measures
text: Returns data frame available measures SWADL API. Measures specific ways presenting indicator data (e.g., nominal vs real wages, counts vs rates).

title: List available measures — swadlr_measures
code: swadlr_measures(indicator = NULL)

title: List available measures — swadlr_measures
text: indicator Optional indicator ID filter measures available specific indicator. Use swadlr_indicators() see available indicators.

title: List available measures — swadlr_measures
text: data frame columns: id Measure identifier (used get_swadl_series()) name Human-readable measure name format Display format (e.g., "dollar", "rate", "count")

title: List available measures — swadlr_measures
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all measures swadlr_measures()  # List measures for a specific indicator swadlr_measures(indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles") } # }

title: List available topics — swadlr_topics
text: Returns data frame available topics SWADL API. Topics broad categories group related indicators.

title: List available topics — swadlr_topics
code: swadlr_topics()

title: List available topics — swadlr_topics
text: data frame columns: id Topic identifier (used filtering indicators) name Human-readable topic name

title: List available topics — swadlr_topics
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ swadlr_topics() } # }

title: swadlr 0.0.0.9000 (development version)
text: Initial development version swadlr. get_swadl_info() returns detailed information indicator, including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability. get_swadl_series() fetches time series data specified indicator, measure, geography, dimension combination. Supports flexible dimension syntax filtering cross-tabulating data. swadlr_clear_cache() clears session cache API metadata. swadlr_dimensions() lists available dimensions values, optionally filtered indicator. swadlr_geographies() lists available geographic units (national, regions, divisions, states). swadlr_indicators() lists available indicators, optionally filtered topic. swadlr_measures() lists available measures, optionally filtered indicator. swadlr_topics() lists available topics.
